issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When a new mobile web project is created, it needs to copy the default splash screen assets into the Resources/mobileweb directory.

During the compile process, needs to try to read in the files in that directory before resorting back to the default splash dir.
fields.summary: MobileWeb: Copy default splash assets into Resouces/mobileweb during new project creation

comments.body:
Pull request: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/1830

Test by creating a new app. Check the Resources/mobileweb dir for a splash folder. Run app and verify splash screen displays.

Verified fix on:
Titanium studio : 2.1.1.201207271312
SDK version : 2.2.0.v20120810194112
Android 4.0.4 - default ,chrome 18.0
Iphone 4.3.5 - safari mobile
Mountain lion(10.8) - chrome 21.0,safari 6,firefox 14.0.1
